comments:
While creating a widget containing a SWT Tree managed by a JFace tree viewer, the exception below occurs ("Item not removed"). This is followed by a VM crash when the application exits (I'll attach the hotspot error dump file).

This only happens after the window has been opened and closed once previously. I can reproduce this reliably, but the system it's running in is too complex to hope to produce a simple test case.

Exception:

  org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: Item not removed

vm_info: Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (1.5.0_07-b03) for windows-x86, built on May  3 2006 01:04:38 by "java_re" with MS VC++ 6.0

Just some further information that might be useful: we're running the SWT app from a thread kicked off by an OSGi bundle. The error occurs after the bundle is closed and the thread is shutdown and then the bundle is started again, creating a new Display and event loop thread. I've been quite careful to ensure all UI operations are done only in the UI thread, and that the thread exits correctly and disposes its Display.

Since a lot of Win32 calls rely on resources being created/destroyed from the same thread, I wonder if it's possible that something from the previous SWT event thread is causing problems for the new one. I've since added code to ensure all cached images etc allocated by the app are disposed, but this hasn't fixed the problem.

I've also found the VM will crash doing just about anything after the "Item not removed" exception, e.g.:

Fixed ... yay!

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 150782 ***
Yay indeed :) How can I find out which SWT release this will go into btw?
It's always the next major release (which is 3.3), unless otherwise specified by the milestone and agreed to by the people working on the problem.  Can you wait?
Forget it, the fix is safe and the failure bad.  I'm marking this for 3.2.2.
Great. I could have waited for 3.3, but that's even better. Thanks!
